com.adisgrace.games

Class TargetModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.adisgrace.games.TargetModel

  • public class TargetModel
extends java.lang.Object
    "Enemy" representation. A target is one of the NPCs that the player is tasked with defeating. All information about individual targets is stored in a JSON, which is used to construct a TargetModel.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  TargetModel.TargetState
      Enumeration representing the target's current state

    • Constructor Summary

      Creates a new Target with the given JSON data.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TargetModel

        public TargetModel()
        Creates a new Target with the given JSON data. All information about a target and their respective pod is stored in a JSON, that is passed into this constructor, where it is parsed. The relevant FactNodes are also created here. // * @param data The JSON with all the target's data.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the name of this target. The target's name is represented as a first and last name with a space in between.
        Returns:
        the target's name.

      • getStress

        public int getStress()
        Returns the current stress level of this target. Stress can only be a value from 0 to maxStress.
        Returns:
        the target's current stress level.

      • getNeighbors

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getNeighbors()
        Returns the names of this target's neighbors. The neighbors of a target are the other targets that are connected to this one. Suspicion is contagious and can spread between adjacent targets. Names are formatted as first then last name, with a space in between.
        Returns:
        array of neighboring targets' names.

      • getMaxStress

        public int getMaxStress()
        Returns the maximum stress level of this target. When the target's stress reaches maxStress, the target becomes Defeated.
        Returns:
        the target's maximum possible stress.

      • getSuspicion

        public int getSuspicion()
        Returns the current suspicion level of this target. Suspicion is always within the range 0-100.
        Returns:
        the target's current suspicion.

      • addStress

        public boolean addStress(int s)
        Increases the target's stress by the given amount. Returns true if the target is still active after adding the stress, and false otherwise, in which case the new stress is greater than or equal to maxStress and the target becomes Defeated.
        Parameters:
        s - Amount by which to increase target's stress
        Returns:
        Whether target is still active and undefeated after adding stress

      • addSuspicion

        public void addSuspicion(int sus)
        Increases the target's suspicion by the given amount. Suspicion is always within the range 0-100.
        Parameters:
        sus - Amount by which to increase target's suspicion

      • nextTurn

        public TargetModel.TargetState nextTurn()
        Handles target AI behavior at the end of each round, then returns the target's state in the next round. This function should be called for every target at the end of every round. At the end of the round, decrement countdown. If countdown reaches 0, then it's time for the next Paranoia check, and handle that depending on current state. Returns the target's state at the top of the next round.
        Returns:
        Target's state at the top of the next round

      • getFirstNodes

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getFirstNodes()
        Returns the list of names of the first nodes in this target's pod. The first nodes are the ones that are visible immediately after the target is spawned in. This DOES NOT return the names of all the nodes in the pod. Nodes are accounts, devices, etc. that are associated with the target and give more information about the target upon scanning. A node's name is an internal keyword used to identify a node, which can be passed into other TargetModel methods to achieve different things.
        Returns:
        Array of names of the first nodes in this target's pod.

      • getNodes

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getNodes()
        Returns list of the names of all the facts in the current target's pod. Nodes are accounts, devices, etc. that are associated with the target and give more information about the target upon scanning. A node's name is an internal keyword used to identify a node, which can be passed into other TargetModel methods to achieve different things.
        Returns:
        Array of names of all the nodes in the target's pod.

      • getTitle

        public java.lang.String getTitle(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the title of the node that the given fact is stored in. The title of a fact's node is what should be displayed when hovering over the node. Ex. "King County Court Records," "Torchlight Personnel File", etc.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the fact whose node's title we want
        Returns:
        Title of the node that the given fact is stored at

      • getNodeCoords

        public com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 getNodeCoords(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the coordinates of a given node. A node's coordinates are relative to the target's location, where the target is at the origin.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the fact whose node's location we want
        Returns:
        Coordinates of the node, relative to the target's location

      • getNodeAssetPath

        public java.lang.String getNodeAssetPath(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the filepath to the location of the map assets for the node. The filepath leads to a folder where all the frames for a node are stored.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the fact whose node's assets we want
        Returns:
        Filepath to folder of node assets

      • getContent

        public java.lang.String getContent(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the content stored in the node with the given name. The content of the node is what is shown to the player when the node is scanned, representing the information stored within that node. It is also what is shown if the player revisits the node to read it again.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the node whose content we want
        Returns:
        Content stored at the given node

      • getSummary

        public java.lang.String getSummary(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the summary stored in the node with the given name. The summary is what is stored in the player's notebook, so they can see a more concise version of the facts they've learned without having to reread each node.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the node whose summary we want
        Returns:
        Summary stored at the given node

      • getChildren

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getChildren(java.lang.String name)
        Returns list of names of child nodes for the given node. A given node's children are the nodes that are made visible when the given node is scanned.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the node whose children we want
        Returns:
        List of the names of children of the given node

      • threaten

        public int threaten(java.lang.String fact)
        Used to threaten the target with the fact stored at the given node. If the fact can be used to threaten, moves the target to the Threatened state, resets the countdown to the next Paranoia check, increases stress accordingly, and returns the damage dealt by the fact. Otherwise, does nothing and returns 0.
        Parameters:
        fact - Name of the node where the threatening fact is stored
        Returns:
        Amount of stress damage dealt by threatening with fact

      • expose

        public int expose(java.lang.String fact)
        Used to expose a fact about the target, which is stored at the given node. Returns the amount of stress damage dealt. If the fact deals nonzero stress damage, moves target to Paranoid.
        Parameters:
        fact - Name of the node where the to-be-exposed fact is stored
        Returns:
        Amount of stress damage dealt by exposing with fact

      • checkForCombo

        public boolean checkForCombo(java.lang.String name,
                             java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> facts)
        Checks if a given fact is part of a combo with any other of the given facts, and if so, updates the relevant information accordingly. If a fact is part of a combo, then the node whose name is the "overwrite" property of the combo will have its summary and stress damage replaced with the summary and stress damage stored in the combo, and this function will return true. Otherwise, nothing happens and the function returns false. If a fact is part of multiple combos that overwrite the same node, the combo that is applied is the longest one. If a fact is part of multiple combos that overwrite different nodes, then all unique combos are applied (if some overwrite the same node, pick the longest).
        Parameters:
        name - Given fact, checks if a given fact is part of a combo with any other of the given facts.
        facts - Other given facts.
